abstract: Bank of America may need to raise much as $37 billion in additional capital later this year to bring an important ratio in line with its peers, according to analysts at Oppenheimer.
snippet: Bank of America may need to raise much as $37 billion in additional capital later this year to bring an important ratio in line with its peers, according to analysts at Oppenheimer.
lead_paragraph: As Wall Street anxiously awaits first-quarter updates from the nation’s largest banks, analysts at Oppenheimer are predicting that Bank of America will need a big slug of new equity.

headline.main: BofA May Need $36.6 Billion, Analysts Say
